titlestmt.titleproper: English families genealogical research card files undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: English families genealogical research card files
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of card files of genealogical information on various English individuals and families from the 15th-19th centuries. These materials may have been compiled by someone researching the Johnson family. Grouped by family name, the cards list names, births, deaths, marriages, and children, though not all information is listed for all people. Family names include Downe, Freeman, Hall, Johnson, Selby, and Stokes. Sources are often not cited, but it appears that much of the information has been extracted from parish registers.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
